verses.kjv: Am I not an apostle? am I not free? have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? are not ye my work in the Lord?
verses.web: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Haven’t I seen Jesus Christ, our Lord? Aren’t you my work in the Lord?
verses.ct: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Haven't I seen Jesus Christ our Lord with my own eyes? Aren't you yourselves the result of my work for the Lord?

verses.kjv: If I be not an apostle unto others, yet doubtless I am to you: for the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.
verses.web: If to others I am not an apostle, yet at least I am to you; for you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.
verses.ct: Even if others don't accept me as an apostle, you certainly should — because your very existence as believers in the Lord is the proof of my calling.

verses.kjv: Mine answer to them that do examine me is this,
verses.web: My defense to those who examine me is this:
verses.ct: Here's my response to anyone who questions my authority:

verses.kjv: Have we not power to eat and to drink?
verses.web: Have we no right to eat and to drink?
verses.ct: Don't we have the right to receive food and drink for our work?

verses.kjv: Have we not power to lead about a sister, a wife, as well as other apostles, and as the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?
verses.web: Have we no right to take along a wife who is a believer, even as the rest of the apostles, and the brothers of the Lord, and Cephas?
verses.ct: Don't we have the right to bring along a believing wife, just like the other apostles do, and the Lord's brothers, and Cephas?

verses.kjv: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?
verses.web: Or have only Barnabas and I no right to not work?
verses.ct: Or are Barnabas and I the only ones expected to support ourselves with outside work?

verses.kjv: Who goeth a warfare any time at his own charges? who planteth a vineyard, and eateth not of the fruit thereof? or who feedeth a flock, and eateth not of the milk of the flock?
verses.web: What soldier ever serves at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard, and doesn’t eat of its fruit? Or who feeds a flock, and doesn’t drink from the flock’s milk?
verses.ct: What soldier pays for his own service? Who plants a vineyard and never eats any of its fruit? Who tends a flock and never drinks any of its milk?

verses.kjv: Say I these things as a man? or saith not the law the same also?
verses.web: Do I speak these things according to the ways of men? Or doesn’t the law also say the same thing?
verses.ct: Am I just making a human argument here? Doesn't the law itself say the same thing?

verses.kjv: For it is written in the law of Moses, Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn. Doth God take care for oxen?
verses.web: For it is written in the law of Moses, “You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the grain.” Is it for the oxen that God cares,
verses.ct: The law of Moses says, "You must not muzzle an ox while it's treading out the grain." Is God really just concerned about oxen?

verses.kjv: Or saith he it altogether for our sakes? For our sakes, no doubt, this is written: that he that ploweth should plow in hope; and that he that thresheth in hope should be partaker of his hope.
verses.web: or does he say it assuredly for our sake? Yes, it was written for our sake, because he who plows ought to plow in hope, and he who threshes in hope should partake of his hope.
verses.ct: No — he was clearly speaking for our benefit. This was written because the person who plows should plow with the hope of a harvest, and the person who threshes should expect to share in the crop.

verses.kjv: If we have sown unto you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?
verses.web: If we sowed to you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we reap your fleshly things?
verses.ct: If we planted spiritual seeds among you, is it too much to ask that we receive material support in return?

verses.kjv: If others be partakers of this power over you, are not we rather? Nevertheless we have not used this power; but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.
verses.web: If others partake of this right over you, don’t we yet more? Nevertheless we didn’t use this right, but we bear all things, that we may cause no hindrance to the Good News of Christ.
verses.ct: If others have the right to be supported by you, don't we have an even greater claim? But we've never used that right. Instead, we put up with anything rather than create an obstacle for the gospel of Christ.

verses.kjv: Do ye not know that they which minister about holy things live of the things of the temple? and they which wait at the altar are partakers with the altar?
verses.web: Don’t you know that those who serve around sacred things eat from the things of the temple, and those who wait on the altar have their portion with the altar?
verses.ct: Don't you know that those who serve in the temple eat from what the temple provides? And those who serve at the altar receive a share of the offerings?

verses.kjv: Even so hath the Lord ordained that they which preach the gospel should live of the gospel.
verses.web: Even so the Lord ordained that those who proclaim the Good News should live from the Good News.
verses.ct: In the same way, the Lord has directed that those who preach the gospel should earn their living from the gospel.

verses.kjv: But I have used none of these things: neither have I written these things, that it should be so done unto me: for it were better for me to die, than that any man should make my glorying void.
verses.web: But I have used none of these things, and I don’t write these things that it may be done so in my case; for I would rather die, than that anyone should make my boasting void.
verses.ct: But I haven't taken advantage of any of these rights. And I'm not writing this so you'll start supporting me now — I'd rather die than let anyone take away this thing I'm proud of.

verses.kjv: For though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to glory of: for necessity is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the gospel!
verses.web: For if I preach the Good News, I have nothing to boast about; for necessity is laid on me; but woe is to me if I don’t preach the Good News.
verses.ct: When I preach the gospel, I can't boast about it — I have no choice in the matter. It would be terrible for me if I didn't preach the gospel!

verses.kjv: For if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward: but if against my will, a dispensation of the gospel is committed unto me.
verses.web: For if I do this of my own will, I have a reward. But if not of my own will, I have a stewardship entrusted to me.
verses.ct: If I do this willingly, I earn a reward. But even if I didn't choose it, I've still been entrusted with this responsibility.

verses.kjv: What is my reward then? Verily that, when I preach the gospel, I may make the gospel of Christ without charge, that I abuse not my power in the gospel.
verses.web: What then is my reward? That when I preach the Good News, I may present the Good News of Christ without charge, so as not to abuse my authority in the Good News.
verses.ct: So what is my reward? Simply this: that when I preach the gospel, I offer it free of charge, without making full use of the rights that come with preaching it.

verses.kjv: For though I be free from all men, yet have I made myself servant unto all, that I might gain the more.
verses.web: For though I was free from all, I brought myself under bondage to all, that I might gain the more.
verses.ct: Even though I'm free and don't answer to anyone, I've made myself a servant to everyone so I can reach as many people as possible.

verses.kjv: And unto the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might gain the Jews; to them that are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain them that are under the law;
verses.web: To the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might gain Jews; to those who are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain those who are under the law;
verses.ct: When I'm with Jews, I live like a Jew to reach Jews. When I'm with people who follow the law, I live as though I'm under the law — even though I'm not — so I can reach those under the law.

verses.kjv: To them that are without law, as without law, (being not without law to God, but under the law to Christ,) that I might gain them that are without law.
verses.web: to those who are without law, as without law (not being without law toward God, but under law toward Christ), that I might win those who are without law.
verses.ct: When I'm with people who don't have the law, I live as they do — though I'm never outside God's law, since I live under the law of Christ — so I can reach those without the law.

verses.kjv: To the weak became I as weak, that I might gain the weak: I am made all things to all men, that I might by all means save some.
verses.web: To the weak I became as weak, that I might gain the weak. I have become all things to all men, that I may by all means save some.
verses.ct: When I'm with those who are weak, I become weak to reach the weak. I've become everything to everyone so that by every possible means I might save some.

verses.kjv: And this I do for the gospel’s sake, that I might be partaker thereof with you.
verses.web: Now I do this for the sake of the Good News, that I may be a joint partaker of it.
verses.ct: I do all of this for the sake of the gospel, so that I can share in its blessings along with you.

verses.kjv: Know ye not that they which run in a race run all, but one receiveth the prize? So run, that ye may obtain.
verses.web: Don’t you know that those who run in a race all run, but one receives the prize? Run like that, that you may win.
verses.ct: You know that in a race, all the runners compete, but only one wins the prize. So run to win!

verses.kjv: And every man that striveth for the mastery is temperate in all things. Now they do it to obtain a corruptible crown; but we an incorruptible.
verses.web: Every man who strives in the games exercises self-control in all things. Now they do it to receive a corruptible crown, but we an incorruptible.
verses.ct: Every athlete trains with strict discipline. They do it for a crown that will wither and fade — but we do it for a crown that lasts forever.

verses.kjv: I therefore so run, not as uncertainly; so fight I, not as one that beateth the air:
verses.web: I therefore run like that, not aimlessly. I fight like that, not beating the air,
verses.ct: That's why I don't run without purpose. That's why I don't fight like someone swinging at the air.

verses.kjv: But I keep under my body, and bring it into subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.
verses.web: but I beat my body and bring it into submission, lest by any means, after I have preached to others, I myself should be rejected.
verses.ct: No, I discipline my body and keep it under control, because after preaching to others, I don't want to end up disqualified myself.
